intent: To highlight the ongoing challenges faced by residents in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene and the impact of federal cuts to public health resources.
data: More than 1,400 households receiving rental assistance
claims: Hurricane Helene caused significant damage in western North Carolina, resulting in 43 fatalities.
The CDC team intended to conduct a survey to assess recovery needs but was fired before the operation.
The cuts at the CDC included the loss of nearly 200 experts and critical public health programs.
Many residents are still inadequately housed, with over 1,400 households receiving FEMA rental assistance.
The area faced a food desert due to the closure of the only grocery store and lack of transportation.
topic: Impact of Hurricane Helene and CDC Cuts
